subprocess_flow.description: The initial step involves receiving employee complaints through various channels such as email, HR portal, or in-person submissions. Each complaint is logged into the HRIS system, and an acknowledgment is sent to the employee to confirm receipt. The intake process ensures that all necessary information is captured for further analysis.

Before GenAI processes the complaint, sensitive employee data is anonymized to comply with GDPR and other privacy regulations. This involves removing or masking personally identifiable information (PII) from the complaint details. The anonymized data is then stored securely for analysis.
success_criteria: PII is removed from complaint data

subprocess_flow.description: GenAI analyzes the anonymized complaint data to identify the nature of the grievance, categorize the issue, and assess its severity. The AI uses natural language processing (NLP) to understand the context and extract relevant information. This triage process helps in prioritizing complaints and routing them to the appropriate HR personnel.

Based on the triage results, GenAI suggests potential resolutions that align with company policies and legal requirements. These suggestions are tailored to the specific nature and severity of the grievance. The AI considers past cases and best practices to provide effective and fair resolution options.

An HR Specialist reviews the GenAI's triage and resolution suggestions. The HR Specialist conducts a thorough investigation, gathering additional information if necessary, and validates the AI's findings. This step ensures human oversight and prevents over-reliance on AI-generated outputs.

The HR Specialist implements the proposed resolution, ensuring that it is communicated clearly to all parties involved. This may involve mediation, disciplinary action, or policy changes. The implementation process is documented in the HRIS system for future reference.

Feedback is collected from the employee who filed the complaint to assess their satisfaction with the resolution. The grievance case is then closed in the HRIS system. This step ensures that the resolution is satisfactory and provides valuable insights for improving the grievance handling process.
success_criteria: Grievance case is closed in HRIS
